main event: A long elongated flame was observed coming from some object at 35,000 feet over Livingston, Montana on August 6, 1957.
interesting points: The object was sighted by a B-47 aircraft, code-named 'Ringbolt 54', flying at 37,000 feet.
The sighting occurred at 2130Z (2110 MST) and lasted for 1 minute.
The weather conditions were described as 'thick', 'dry', with a 'slight breeze' and 'warm' temperature.
No further information was available in the report.
The report was filed in accordance with Air Force Regulation 200-2 dated August 12, 1954.
sighted object: a long, green flame coming from some object
